general_city_data.attractions: São Jorge Castle, Jerónimos Monastery, Belém Tower, Alfama district, Tram 28, Oceanário de Lisboa, Praça do Comércio, Time Out Market Lisboa, Cristo Rei.
general_city_data.description: Lisbon, Portugal's vibrant capital, is a captivating city blending traditional heritage with modern innovation. Perched on the Tagus River estuary, it's renowned for its hilly terrain, offering stunning panoramic views from viewpoints like São Jorge Castle and the Alfama district. Cobblestone streets wind through historic neighborhoods, revealing charming cafes, Fado houses, and colorful buildings adorned with intricate tilework. Lisbon boasts a rich maritime history, evident in landmarks like Belém Tower and Jerónimos Monastery. The city's culinary scene is a delight, with fresh seafood, pastel de nata, and local wines tempting every palate. Lisbon is a city that effortlessly combines old-world charm with a contemporary spirit.
general_city_data.history: Lisbon is one of the oldest cities in Western Europe, predating many other modern European capitals. It has been inhabited since Neolithic times and later settled by Phoenicians, Greeks, and Romans. In the 8th century, it was conquered by the Moors, who influenced its architecture and culture for centuries. In 1147, Afonso Henriques, the first King of Portugal, captured Lisbon, making it the capital of the Kingdom in 1255. During the Age of Discovery, Lisbon became a major trading center, accumulating wealth and power. The devastating earthquake of 1755 destroyed much of the city, leading to its reconstruction under the direction of the Marquis of Pombal. Today, Lisbon is a thriving metropolis and a major European tourist destination.
general_city_data.weather: Mediterranean climate with mild, wet winters and warm, dry summers. Average temperatures range from 8°C (46°F) in winter to 28°C (82°F) in summer.

itinerary_response.overall_description: This itinerary prioritizes flexibility, allowing you to explore Lisbon at your own pace. It focuses on experiencing the city's diverse offerings within a 5km radius of the city center, accommodating any budget and mode of transport. From historic landmarks to vibrant neighborhoods, this plan provides a framework for discovering Lisbon's unique charm. The suggested activities can be adapted to your interests, whether you prefer delving into history, enjoying panoramic views, or indulging in local cuisine. Remember to check opening hours and transport options before heading out, and feel free to substitute any suggested point of interest with something that better suits your preferences.

points_of_interest.description_poi: A grand, historic square on the Tagus River, perfect for a stroll and enjoying the views. Once the gateway to Lisbon, it's now a vibrant hub with cafes and shops.
points_of_interest.name: Praça do Comércio

points_of_interest.address: R. de Santa Cruz do Castelo, 1100-129 Lisboa, Portugal
points_of_interest.description_poi: A Moorish castle offering stunning panoramic views of Lisbon. Explore its ramparts, towers, and archaeological site, learning about the city's history.
points_of_interest.name: Castelo de São Jorge

points_of_interest.description_poi: Lisbon's oldest district, characterized by narrow, winding streets, traditional Fado houses, and historic churches. Get lost in its labyrinthine alleys and soak up the authentic atmosphere.
points_of_interest.name: Alfama District

points_of_interest.description_poi: Lisbon's oldest church, a Romanesque cathedral with Gothic and Baroque elements. Admire its architecture and explore its treasury and cloisters.
points_of_interest.name: Lisbon Cathedral (Sé de Lisboa)

points_of_interest.description_poi: A vibrant food hall offering a wide variety of Portuguese cuisine from top chefs and restaurants. Sample local delicacies, enjoy a drink, and soak up the lively atmosphere.
points_of_interest.name: Time Out Market Lisboa

points_of_interest.description_poi: A UNESCO World Heritage Site, this stunning monastery showcases Manueline architecture and is a symbol of Portugal's Age of Discoveries.
points_of_interest.name: Jerónimos Monastery

points_of_interest.description_poi: A fortified tower on the Tagus River, also a UNESCO World Heritage Site, that served as a point of embarkation and disembarkation for Portuguese explorers and as a ceremonial gateway to Lisbon.
points_of_interest.name: Belém Tower

points_of_interest.address: R. de Santa Cruz do Castelo, 1100-129 Lisboa
points_of_interest.description_poi: A Moorish castle occupying a commanding hilltop overlooking Lisbon, offering panoramic views of the city and the Tagus River.
points_of_interest.name: São Jorge Castle

points_of_interest.address: Esplanada D. Carlos I s/nº, 1990-005 Lisboa
points_of_interest.description_poi: One of the largest aquariums in Europe, featuring a vast array of marine life from around the world.
points_of_interest.name: Oceanário de Lisboa

points_of_interest.description_poi: A historic tram line that winds its way through the narrow streets of Lisbon's oldest districts, offering a unique and charming way to see the city.
points_of_interest.name: Tram 28
points_of_interest.opening_hours: Varies depending on the specific tram and time of day.

points_of_interest.description_poi: A grand square located on the Tagus River, historically the gateway to Lisbon and a center of commerce.
points_of_interest.name: Praça do Comércio

points_of_interest.description_poi: A former industrial complex transformed into a vibrant hub for creative businesses, shops, restaurants, and art installations.
points_of_interest.name: LX Factory
points_of_interest.opening_hours: Varies depending on the specific shop or restaurant.

points_of_interest.description_poi: A vibrant food hall showcasing the best of Lisbon's culinary scene, with stalls from renowned chefs and local vendors.
points_of_interest.name: Time Out Market Lisboa

points_of_interest.address: Alfama, Largo do Chafariz de Dentro, 1, 1100-139 Lisboa
points_of_interest.description_poi: Dedicated to the traditional Portuguese music genre of Fado.
points_of_interest.name: Fado Museum
